definition[0]: to officially decide who is right in a disagreement and decide what should be done
example[0]: The Dean adjudicates any faculty disputes.
example[1]: The owner can appeal to the court to adjudicate on the matter.
example[2]: The judge adjudicated that he should be released.
definition[1]: to be the judge in a competition
example[3]: He adjudicated at all the regional music competitions.
definition[2]: to officially decide who is right in an argument between two groups or organizations
example[4]: The union has offered to adjudicate the claim.
example[5]: The court refused to adjudicate on the issue until all construction activities on the disputed site had ceased.
definition[3]: to be judged by a court of law to be unable to pay debts
